attributes.action: Allow first time buyers to use their pension savings as a deposit for mortgage
attributes.background: It is very difficult to save up the money and sometimes unrealistic.

attributes.action: Government to ban the production and use of all non-recyclable plastic by 2020.
attributes.background: Plastic is choking each and every one of us.  It has filled the land, sea and air. We may not want to accept it but it is in our face. We would like the government to take the initiative to stop the production so it is not available for use in UK and other countries will follow.
attributes.additional_details:
A Roadmap for Sustainability report found more than 60 countries have introduced bans which are one of the most effective ways to reduce the use of disposable plastic.
Plastic items can take up to 1000 years to decompose in landfills. But plastic bags we use in our everyday life take 10-1000 years to decompose, burning it is not an option as well as it releases toxic fumes into the air.
UN warned at current levels the earth could be awash with 12 billion tonnes of plastic trash by the middle of the century.

attributes.action: Sensory Therapy to be offered in all areas
attributes.background:
My son has been denied sensory therapy recently, due to it not being commissioned in our area. This is due to there not being enough research to prove it's needed. 
My child, along with thousands of others need sensory therapy just as much as everyone needs access to a GP. 

This needs to change
attributes.additional_details:
I have written to the commisioners but had no joy, therefore I have taken this to the parliamentary ombudsman and I want to get as many signatures as possible to support my case and get our voices heard. 

Please sign. It takes 2 minutes but could help children for a lifetime.

attributes.action: Protect British food and drink in future trade deals
attributes.background: I would like the Government to act now and introduce legislation that ensures protected designation of origin (PDO), protected geographical indication (PGI), and traditional specialities guaranteed (TSG), remain a part of the British food and drink industry post Brexit.
attributes.additional_details: I urge you to back British business and sign our petition that will help promote our vital food and drink industries.

attributes.action: Require school housing facilities (boarding houses) to provide recycling bins
attributes.background: Young minds should be taught the importance of protecting the planet so it is there for future generations.In the countryside the evidence of humans encroaching on the environment is very clear. Schools have the ability to change the minds of the future and should use this ability for our benefit.
attributes.additional_details: School’s with an average of 650 pupils plus staff produces a lot of waste annually. That waste should be disposed of correctly and safely.Up to 60% of the rubbish that ends up in the bin could be recycled and isn’t. Also, there is 260 million tons of plastic produced each year (globally), about 10 percent ends up in our oceans. This plastic can take between 450-1000 years to decompose.

attributes.action: To change the Gambling Act to protect minors from loot boxes in computer games.
attributes.background: Games companies are making poor quality games to maximize player spending. Players are gambling real world currency, by exchanging it for virtual currency to play built in slot machines. There are match making algorithms to match weaker players with better ones.
attributes.additional_details:
This will make the weaker player jealous, tempting them to gambling money on the loot boxes on the pay-to-win game. Gambling can be addictive, and children are more susceptible to being addicted. All the transactions and electronically automated, so children with no concept of money will keep opening loot boxes. It's a very scummy, shady tactic used by some games companies. And it's typically the case that the only thing you can buy in the game is solely the virtual currency for opening loot boxes in one game mode
 
Please sign

attributes.action: Allow UK students to use student loans within the EU - OR lower tuition fees
attributes.background: The conservative government in power should allow UK students to use their student loans to study at universities within the EU after Brexit OR lower our tuition fee's to minimize out debt for an education we surely need if the country is going to function without EU professional workers.
attributes.additional_details:
The freedom of information responses compiled by the Liberal Democrats from 80 of the 136 NHS acute trusts in England shows that 2,700 EU nurses left the health service in 2016, compared to 1,600 EU nurses in 2014 – a 68% increase.

If leaving the EU means letting go of many of our much-needed professionals, the UK university tuition fees need to either be lowered or student loans need to allow our youth to study where it's cheaper.

The average student debt at graduation is £50,800 - source IFS.

Do we really expect our youngest and brightest to thrive with that much debt on their shoulders?

attributes.action: Jeremy Hunt to make full apology for comparing the EU and Soviet Union
attributes.background: The foreign secretary, Jeremy Hunt, has been rebuked by the European Commission for a speech at the Conservative party conference where he seemed to compare the European Union to the Soviet Union. Such remarks are damaging to Britain as a nation and particularly so coming from the Foreign Secretary.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2018/oct/01/jeremy-hunt-draws-eu-ire-over-soviet-prison-comparison

attributes.action: Ban the use of horses within the police force
attributes.background: We want to ban the use of horses within the police force. Often the horses are put into dangerous and uncontrolled situations such as football games or marches which leads to distress for the animal. The horse is being exploited and is not having the freedom which we have and take for granted.
attributes.additional_details: I recently witnessed a Police horse struggling to walk, looking in pain along with acting distressed as it walked down a busy main road in Manchester. It is unfair and there are other means the Police could have used such as bikes, as this was a quiet Wednesday evening there was no need to have the horse out. The policeofficer was not able to control the situation in a calm & effective manner to which the horse would be taken out of the dangerous situation for both the horse and the public.

attributes.action: Scrap Vehicle Excise Duty and raise excise duty on fuel.
attributes.background: Instead of wasting valuable police resources chasing untaxed drivers, when they should be tackling more serious crime, scrap VED and add 10 pence to the price of a litre of fuel. That way, the more you drive the more you pay.
attributes.additional_details: We all know that manufacturer's fuel consumption figures are very unreliable. This way people will pay the fair amount due in tax based on their consumption and their mileage. It doesn't penalise the drivers who have to have a car because bus services in their rural area are non- existent and without a car they wouldn't be able to get to hospitals for appointments or to the shop for essentials.

attributes.action: Call for an immediate halt to the offense on Idlib and an international debate
attributes.background:
Our prime minister must join those applying pressure on Russia and Iran to stop such an onslaught. Apply pressure on the UN to do what it can in calling for diplomacy. 
Find ways to help the civilians to protect themselves and deal with the humanitarian disaster which looms.
attributes.additional_details: Let us not stand by and watch whilst another humanitarian crisis unfolds. We must raise our voices in opposition!

attributes.action: Appeal for the UN to ban Lethal Autonomous Weapons
attributes.background: Countries across the world are on the verge to finish artificially intelligent weapons by 2019. These machines will result in unfathomable consequences that humans cannot foresee. International legislation must be pressured by the UK to keep up to date before the technology is finished and utilised.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lethal_autonomous_weapon

https://autonomousweapons.org

https://futureoflife.org/2018/04/30/lethal-autonomous-weapons-an-update-from-the-united-nations/?cn-reloaded=1

https://www.janes.com/article/79311/china-s-shock-call-for-ban-on-lethal-autonomous-weapon-systems

attributes.action: For victims of crime to have rights to appeal a not guilty verdict.
attributes.background: After taking my abusers to court, they were found not guilty. We should have rights like the person found guilty has fair justice. If the person's found guilty they can appeal against the sentence or case. Victims should have a proper right to appeal.
attributes.additional_details: And when the CPS and police mess your case up, like mine, there should be the right for victims to appeal. There is not enough space to put everything on. But I reach out to other victims and people in England to, get a fair justice system for now and in the future. With rights other victims may come forward.

attributes.action: Stop playing Vivaldi as hold music on the benefit enquiries line.
attributes.background: Whilst it is understandable that businesses do need waiting music to occupy the minds of enquirers, playing Vivaldi's 'Spring' over and over again creates associations incompatible with the normal levels of appreciation that one should have for such a classical musician.
attributes.additional_details: Several benefit numbers spout the same song over and over again. After 15 minutes one becomes irked. After 20 minutes, the music has slightly disturbing undertones and after 30 minutes the listener turns exasperated, frantic and starts to shout at their handset. This is not ideal: it breeds frustration and resentment at Vivaldi, the benefits line and possibly the government as a whole.

attributes.action: Lower the percentage for child maintenance deductions from earnings
attributes.background: The current cms payment scheme for non resident parents has a massive impact on non resident working people that are paying rent and bills for their current living situation. A drop in pay or overtime no less than 25 % will leave you with nothing to pay rent and bills.
attributes.additional_details: Non resident fathers will be left in financial difficulty with the cms payment scheme and would be forced to leave work this is not good for the kids that need money.

attributes.action: Place a ban on companies demanding experience for 'factory floor' jobs.
attributes.background: Coffee houses, supermarkets, clothes stores and others demand experience to work on tills, stock shelves and make drinks. The average person can cook, clean, hang laundry and treat people decently. So, why do these daily tasks, skills and experiences need to be gained from previous employment?
attributes.additional_details:
If education is the key to a better life, then why is 'work experience' the lock keeping people barren. This may predominantly affect millennials, but it affects others too. There are people who want to work, but get rejected; when they just want to give back to society. 

If I can't obtain a job, due to a lack of work/job-related experience. Yet, to obtain work/job-related experience, I need a job. However, an employer won't hire me; due to a lack of work/job-related experience. Then the system becomes a punishment for those who desire knowledge and to be better & productive members of society.

attributes.action: Condemn the Bangladeshi Government's violent crackdown on student protests.
attributes.background: The protests demanding more stringent road safety, were triggered when 2 students were killed by a speeding bus.The student-led protests are being targeted by state-sponsored violence. Bangladesh's government has also shut down access to mobile internet in many parts of the country in response.
attributes.additional_details:
The Telegraph and the BBC have noted the use of rubber bullets by the police. Online evidence, being shared by the protesters, also point to sexual assault and violent attacks carried out by the student wing of the ruling party, Awami League and the authorities.
Per the WHO, there are 20,000 road fatalities every year in Bangladesh. The government's violent crackdown is thought to be fueled by fears of anti-government sentiments leading up to the general election.

attributes.action: Make it legal in England to marry in a forest as it legal in Scotland
attributes.background: My son and his fiancee would like as would possibly many others to marry in a forest. Please help to try and make this happen

attributes.action: Introduce a subject covering covering current events to the secondary curriculum
attributes.background: After completing my GCSEs last summer, I noticed that there were a lack of subjects explaining current events that will effect my future, and I believe, as a school's purpose is to educate their students, and prepare them for their future, a class covering current events would help prepare them.
attributes.additional_details: Adding a 'current events' subject to the secondary curriculum across the UK would help greatly in making the students more aware of the world that they're about to go into.

attributes.action: Make Albanian a GCSE or A Level
attributes.background: There are thousands and thousands of young Albanians and Kosovans across our country, and we have to value this, make 'Shqip' a language you can pick for your GCSE's. England is supposed to be a very multicultural country and we have to value it.

attributes.action: Stop people buying animals for Christmas then getting rid of them,
attributes.background: Anyone getting an animal should be made to have a licence, as well as the animal being chipped, 1,000 pound fine for anyone who decides to just dump there animal, or imprisonment. Also a 5,000 pound license for animal breaders and only 2 litters aloud. All puppy kittens to be chipped.

attributes.action: Regulate fitness professional qualifications and ban fast track courses.
attributes.background: The fitness industry is suffering from underqualifed and inexperienced people masquerading as “professionals” due to fast track courses. We ask For a set standard for the qualification of both “fitness instructor” and “personal trainer” positions to avoid public injury and dangerous misinformation.

attributes.action: Lower the age of being able to change your name by deed poll to 13
attributes.background: A teenager should be able to change their name if they want to and not have to wait until they are 16.
attributes.additional_details:
I know a lot of teens that wanted to change their names before they hit 13 but they couldn't because they don't always have permission off both parents even if one parent has been absent for most of their lives or has caused destruction in their lives.
They should have the right to decide.

attributes.action: Reduce The Minimum Income Requirement for Spouse Visa
attributes.background: Government should reduce the minimum income requirement for British spouse visa, from £18,600 to £14,400. In many jobs, a person can save a lot from their monthly income and can provide for two people (themselves and the spouse) without relying on public funds. The incomes are lower outside London.
attributes.additional_details: Many British citizens working in the UK on slightly lower pay, especially outside London. They’re employed and the income they earn are enough to provide for themselves and the spouse. The government should consider this. In Scotland, Wales or Northern Ireland, the income rates are lower than England.

attributes.action: All car parks should have at least 10% electric car charging stations (free).
attributes.background: All car parks with more than 10 bays should have mandatory car charging stations available. All office building and warehouses with permanent employee presence where the car is parked for more than 8 hours should have free car charging facilities.
attributes.additional_details:
People go in super markets and normally spend 20 to 60 minutes, car manufacturers say that the car be charged from 20% to 80% in 40 minutes, these 40 minutes should be utilised and people will have the cars charged up when they are done shopping, and this charging should be free.
The 10% minimum requirement mentioned above should be raised by 5% each year.
At permanent place of work this energy for car charging should mainly come from Solar panels.

attributes.action: Ban sugar in Leisure Centres, Hospitals & all other places that promote health.
attributes.background: The government is not doing enough to tackle obesity so, in places that are meant to be promoting health, a total ban on sugared products would quite simply just make sense. Being able to buy a chocolate bar and fully sugared drink in a gym is a total contradiction of its purpose.
attributes.additional_details: Sugar is the number 1 cause of children being admitted to hospital in the U.K. for oral problems. Type 2 diabetes has never been so abundant. High street stores are having to change their sizing criteria. Education is the most powerful tool in which you can change the world but when no one is properly educating and no one is properly listening, removing choice is the only way to get proper results.

attributes.action: Dissolve
attributes.background:
Dissolution is the official term for the end of a Parliament. 25 days after a successful motion to dissolve a general election must be held.
Members of parliament in all parties fear the result of a general election too much to table the motion so we, the people, must demand it to see it happen.
attributes.additional_details:
"On a motion to dissolve the Parliament then in existence dissolves at the beginning of the 25th working day before the polling day for the next parliamentary general election as determined under section 1 or appointed under section 2(7)" Fixed-term Parliament Act of 2011.
The Government does not resign when Parliament is dissolved. Government ministers remain in charge of their departments but may not after the result of the election is known and a new administration is formed.

attributes.action: Abolish Ban on Entertainment Shows using House of Commons Footage.
attributes.background:
'no extracts of Parliamentary proceedings may be used in any light entertainment programme or in a programme of political satire'
 
This is a rule of coverage for Parliamentary footage that has existed since 1989. It is an infringement on both freedom of speech and press.
attributes.additional_details:
https://publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm200203/cmselect/cmbroad/786/786.pdf -Page 22
 
With the globalisation of media through the internet and social media, it is now foolish to assume that the electorate will be 'protected' from seeing satirical footage of Parliament.
 
Without a constitution, we MUST uphold individual freedoms in statute law. This can only be done by ridding of this futile and ineffective regulation.

attributes.action: Introduce a regulatory body for the recruitment industry
attributes.background: A regulatory body should be introduced to ensure recruiters play fair with all parties.

attributes.action: Allow more funding for Ex-Military and Ex-Service personnel suffering with PTSD.
attributes.background: It is far too common for our Ex- Service and Ex-Military personnel to be suffering with PTSD. People who suffer from PTSD often suffer from nightmares, flashbacks, difficulty sleeping, and feeling emotionally numb. These symptoms can significantly impair a person's daily life.
attributes.additional_details:
Why should the people who fought so hard for our lives be the ones left to suffer?

PTSD is marked by clear physical and psychological symptoms. It often has symptoms like depression, substance abuse, problems of memory and cognition, and other physical and mental health problems. The disorder is also associated with difficulties in social or family life, including occupational instability, marital problems, family discord, and difficulties in parenting.

REF- https://www.military.com/benefits/veterans-health-care/posttraumatic-stress-disorder-overview.html

attributes.action: Review racially discriminatory Gang Matrix(ces) obedience to human rights laws.
attributes.background: The Gang Matrix launched by Trident Gang Command is a system that has been found to disproportionately target BAME young men in their relation, or lack thereof, to gang crime. Information is often shared with other authorities limiting their access to opportunities and their chances of success.
attributes.additional_details:
The Metropolitan Police Service Gangs Violence Matrix and other similar Matrices should be dismantled, unless police services can demonstrate that they have been brought in line with international human rights law, in particular, the right to non-discrimination, privacy and family life, as contained in international human rights law. 
For further details read the recommendations highlighted in Amnesty International report: https://www.amnesty.org.uk/files/reports/Trapped%20in%20the%20Matrix%20Amnesty%20report.pdf

attributes.action: Ban (military grade armour piercing) 0.50 or higher calibre rifles in the UK
attributes.background:
Despite the overwhelming support for strict gun control in the United Kingdom the Government is failing to ban certain military-grade guns in its new Offensive Weapons Bill.

This is unacceptable and places the British public at direct risk.
attributes.additional_details:
https://services.parliament.uk/bills/2017-19/offensiveweapons.html

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-politics-46377250

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/government-ban-50-caliber-offensive-weapons-bill-sajid-javid-violence-a8657046.html

attributes.action: Reinstate the Senior care worker on the job shortage list (Tier 2 visa General)
attributes.background: All care sectors across the UK, have benefited from staffing through Senior care workers being on job shortage list (Tier 2 General). Since the removal of this profession from the list it has been increasingly difficult for employers to find staff to work  senior care job roles.
attributes.additional_details: Care settings such as NHS, private residential homecare, nursing homes and domiciliary care have all benefited for this profession being on the job shortage list.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of non-biodegradable cigarette filters in the UK.
attributes.background: Cigarette butts are the most common form of man-made litter in the world. It is estimated that 4.5 trillion cigarette butts become litter every year. The fibres used as the predominant filter material do not readily biodegrade. A normal lifespan of a discarded filter is thought to be up to 15 years!
attributes.additional_details: Banning the sale of certain materials is an effective way to force manufacturers to create alternatives. Fines have not stopped individuals from littering (just look at the floor on your own high-street!). Manufacturers won't change from cheaper, more environmentally damaging materials unless their hand is forced. So, let's force their hands!

attributes.action: Remove Foundation and Higher GCSE papers and have the same paper for everyone.
attributes.background: We feel as though we are being set up for failure as we are not even able to achieve a 6 in a foundation paper when we know we could achieve higher than a 4/5
attributes.additional_details: we think it’s unequal and not fair that other students get a higher opportunity of success therefor we know we probably would not be able to do so well in the higher paper so we believe the test should include foundation and higher paper questions combined into one science and maths should be the same so that everyone has the same chance.

attributes.action: Force Rail Ticketing to allow for WFH and Auto Delay/Cancellation Repayments
attributes.background:
Our Rail ticketing is clearly out of date and the rail companies are failing 
1) Automatic Repayments should be mandatory for Delays and Cancellations 
2)With occasional Working From Home, tickets should be for a number of days usage not a calendar month or year
attributes.additional_details: The last few year rail travel has been appalling, Southern started a scheme to automatically refund for delays, South Western Railway have stopped this without filling in forms needing completion. They have our details linked to the ticket, this should be an automatic process. Our ticketing is out of date and the rail companies are frankly failing.

attributes.action: £85,000 turnover to remain non-taxable after becoming VAT registered.
attributes.background: For small businesses to grow allow taking of £85,000 (VAT threshold) to be non-taxable and exempt from VAT. Only make business pay 20% VAT on takings which exceed the threshold and not on the total taxable turnover. Currently becoming VAT registered as a small business is financially crippling.

attributes.action: Require dining establishments (restaurants, bars, pubs) to offer metal straws.
attributes.background: In response to the problem of an ever-increasing amount of plastic waste polluting our environment, we need to make restaurants, bars, pubs and any similar establishments offer metal straws as a substitution for plastic straws. This will benefit our planet, dining establishments and customers alike.
attributes.additional_details: Metal straws are a better alternative to paper straws as they are reusable. Similar to dishware including mugs and glasses, metal straws can be washed and reused. Therefore, the use of metal straws will produce no waste. The reusable nature of metal straws also provide financial benefits for the establishments as it is a one-time purchase. Furthermore, it addresses the 'soggy' issue of paper straws providing a practical alternative that all people can use.

attributes.action: Funding/ Installation of Wildlife Crossings (Eco Bridges)
attributes.background: We should be funding safe alternatives for animals to pass over or under our busy dangerous roads. We build these roads through their habitats and offer nothing to prevent thousands of animals deaths occurring each year. Something must be done to help protect our struggling wildlife population.
attributes.additional_details:
Examples of successful Eco Bridges are in The Netherlands (over 66 crossings), Australia, Germany, California, Florida, Canada and many more. All have been successful in increasing numbers in wildlife.
The 4 ways that roads negatively impact wildlife: 1 decrease in habitat, 2 increase mortality due to wildlife-vehicle collisions, 3 prevent access to resources on the other side of the road, and 4 they subdivide wildlife populations into smaller and more vulnerable sub-populations.

attributes.action: Stop firework work displays  on armistice Sunday
attributes.background: Today  on the 11/11/2018 silence fell at 11am to mark 100 years  of the first world war and  silence was across  the globe. No fireworks on this day

attributes.action: Large donations to political parties validated by the Electoral Commission
attributes.background:
At present each political party validates large donations to their party. The Electoral Commission should validate and either approve or reject the donation . After validation the funds would be transferred to the party.
Make all donations and rejected donations public. Apply one set of rules.

attributes.action: Improvement of animal welfare labelling on all animal or animal produce products
attributes.background: Displaying shocking pictures like that on smoking packets of the welfare standards for the worse welfare foods and a rated system on all animal produce/meat foods. Legal labelling for all foods and restaurants including foods incorporating meat or produce.
attributes.additional_details: Our labelling of meat sold in supermarkets is awful. We have the red tractor and we have RSPCA assured. I am very annoyed that we still sell caged chicken eggs, why? To save the consumer a matter of pence, at the detriment to the animal, then you have “free range” which doesn’t always mean that their welfare is higher than that of a caged chicken.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of Hair dye to the public.
attributes.background: According to the BBC 33% of the public that dye there hair at home have some form of reaction, Many of this 33% have had a terrible reaction leading them into hospital and seeking expert advice. The public some into salons for hair colourist to fix there problem which can be a very long process.
attributes.additional_details: I push that the sale of hair dye should be prohibited, This will decrease the % of people having a reaction to hair dye. Hairdressers always preform a patch test to check if someone is allergic to the main chemical ingredients of hair dye. I ask that hair dye is strictly available for professionals only who hold the relevant qualification.

attributes.action: Enforce companies to label products and packaging with decomposition dates.
attributes.background: I am just an ordinary person who wants to help save our planet from drowning in plastic. If every item and its packaging were labelled with a date showing how much time they would take to decompose, then companies would be forced to re-evaluate their products and packaging.
attributes.additional_details: Labelling goods and packaging with decomposition dates would also increase awareness in society and people would make informed environmental choices when buying items. There is plastic everywhere. Take a walk around your local supermarket, or any other shop and observe the masses of plastic that is literally everywhere. Some normal plastic items can take up to 1000 years to decompose. A plastic bottle can take up to 450 years or more. If the government agreed to decomposition date labels on all goods and packaging, it would be a step in the right direction.

attributes.action: Require all Staffordshire bull terriers to be muzzled & leashed when in public.
attributes.background: Legislation is required to combat attacks by Staffordshire bull terriers.
attributes.additional_details: Legislation is required to combat attacks by Staffordshire bull terriers. Dog chipping has not resulted in any reduction in dangerous dog attacks as claimed by politicians prior to the introduction of that legislation.

attributes.action: Hold banks properly to account over negligent handling of bank card fraud claims
attributes.background:
Banks are currently allowed to deny card fraud claims without providing evidence for their decision to customers.

They are not protecting our money and personal data from card fraud. At a time when large companies suffer mass data breaches this is not acceptable behaviour and should be penalised.
attributes.additional_details:
Banks avoid reimbursing the value of stolen funds, or compensating victims of bank fraud, not least because the Police, Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) and Financial Ombudsman Service (FOS) are under-resourced and unable to cope with a growing epidemic of digital crime.

Government should:

- ask the FCA to conduct an investigation into this issue;
- amend the law to allow the FCA or FOS to issue fines in individual cases; and
- better resource the Ombudsman to conduct further investigations.

attributes.action: UK to impose sanctions on Saudi Arabia.
attributes.background: The world is in shock of the brutality of Saudi Arabia's politicians!

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory 42 year prison sentences for using a knife against another.
attributes.background: The knife crime epidemic in the UK is out of control.  There is at present no suitable deterrent and with the increasing lawlessness and lack of visible policing, evildoers are increasingly prepared to threaten and use a knife against a fellow citizen.  Knife injuries for victims are life sentences.
attributes.additional_details:
https://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/SN04304

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/uk-knife-crime-police-gang-violence-stabbings-record-figures-a8589626.html

https://www.statista.com/statistics/864736/knife-crime-in-london/

https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/crimeandjustice/bulletins/crimeinenglandandwales/yearendingmarch2018

attributes.action: All consumables, must by law have a biodegradable time scale stated them.
attributes.background: If for example "Bio 1mo" or "Bio 600yr" had to be printed or stamped on consumables by law.  Making consumers see how long their item will take to biodegrade may make ppl think twice. Biodegradable is a misinterpreted word, by stating actual time scales consumers can make an informed decision.
attributes.additional_details: We are killing our planet, slowly suffocating it. People still do not like to be told what to do, by putting the ball back in their hands, letting them make the choice by actually seeing what effect their lifestyle has in real time may make ppl think more and make better chioces.

attributes.action: Public inquiry into Barnsley Local Authority Social Services
attributes.background: A Judge seriously criticised Barnsley Local Authority Social Services  for their heavy-handed tactics whilst conducting safeguarding investigations into a vulnerable child who talked about “wanting to kill herself to be with her mum” who had committed suicide.
attributes.additional_details: The actions of Barnsley Social Services have also been criticised by others and should be subject to a public inquiry.
